flawed_nl_solution:
Store A has a $125 x 2/25 = $<<125*2/25=10>>10 discount.
So the smartphone from store A will only cost $125 - $10 = $<<125-10=115>>115.
Store B has a $130 x 1/10 = $<<130*1/10=13>>13 discount.
So the smartphone from store B will only cost $130 - $13 = $<<130-13=171>>171.
Thus, store A's smartphone is $171 - $115 = $<<171-115=56>>56 cheaper than that of store B.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 117, not 171. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
